A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Episode VIII I've seen even twice\, and I have to say I did not disappoint. I absolutely understand why some people see this episode so controversial\, but their arguments are odd in my view.\nI do not think that this part would kill Star Wars fabulous roots. In my opinion\, he is just shifting away and heading for a new world without his solid pillars\, trying to replace them with new ones. Of course\, I mean the original heroes and the new generation. But the basic one remains\, and it is the struggle between good and evil.\nIn conclusion\, we can only say that this part was just such a preparation for the big final\, and as Luke himself said\, \"The real war is coming yet\"\, and especially the conclusion itself showed unequivocally that the resistance can be defeated but never eradicated because future generations are growing. This is why it would not hurt the episode IX if it happened ten years later from episode VIII.
